Headline: Sensex jumps 800 points: 3 factors behind today's stock market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex climbed 802.66 points to 78,844.25 by 11:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 243 points to trade at 23,828.60.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices surged sharply in early trade, breaking a week-long losing streak and providing much-needed relief to investors. The S&P BSE Sensex climbed 802.66 points to 78,844.25 by 11:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 243 points to trade at 23,828.60. Broader market indices also rebounded as market volatility eased significantly during the session.HEAVYWEIGHT STOCKS GAIN Heavyweight banking, financial services, and IT stocks played a significant role in driving today’s rally. Metal and realty stocks also performed well, adding to the momentum. Leading contributors included Reliance Industries Limited and HDFC Bank, with gains of up to 1.7%. Stocks such as JSW Steel, ITC, Tech Mahindra, and Wipro also posted notable gains, further supporting the market’s recovery. Analysts at Emkay Global raised HDFC Bank’s target price to Rs 2,100 from Rs 2,000, citing the bank’s attractive valuations and robust asset quality, which is expected to outperform peers. The positive outlook for HDFC Bank provided additional confidence to investors.METAL STOCKS JUMP Metal stocks rose 1.3% after the Directorate General of Trade Remedies initiated a safeguard probe into imports of non-alloy and alloy steel flat products. Investec highlighted that domestic steelmakers, particularly Tata Steel and JSW Steel, could benefit from the potential imposition of safeguard duties. Tata Steel gained 1.7%, while JSW Steel surged 3%.STRONG GLOBAL CUES Global cues also supported the rally, with Asian markets climbing after data showed US inflation remained subdued. The MSCI Asia ex-Japan index rose 1.3%, buoyed by expectations of a less aggressive stance by the US Federal Reserve. Despite today’s gains, market experts caution against over-optimism. Dr. VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, added that foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold Rs 15,826 crore last week due to India’s economic slowdown and better returns in US markets. While rebounds like today’s offer temporary relief, experts believe a sustained rally will depend on clear signs of economic growth revival, which may only emerge in early 2025.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 23, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Concord Enviro IPO closes for bidding: Check latest subscription, GMP The Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 500.33 crore. It consists of a fresh issue of 25 lakh shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 46 lakh shares valued at Rs 325.33 crore.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Concord Enviro Systems Limited will close for bidding on Monday, December 23, 2024. The IPO, which opened on December 19, 2024, has attracted decent subscription numbers across investor categories. By the morning of Day 3 (December 23, 2024, 11:09 AM), the Concord Enviro IPO had been subscribed 1.82 times. In the retail category, it was subscribed 2.72 times, while the Non-Institutional Investor (NII) category saw a subscription of 2.01 times. However, the Qualified Institutional Buyer (QIB) segment lagged, with only 0.02 times subscription. The Concord Enviro IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 500.33 crore. It consists of a fresh issue of 25 lakh shares, which will raise Rs 175 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 46 lakh shares valued at Rs 325.33 crore. The funds from the fresh issue will be utilised by the company for its business needs, while the proceeds from the OFS will go to the selling shareholders. The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 665 and Rs 701 per share. Retail investors can bid for a minimum of one lot, which contains 21 shares, requiring a minimum investment of Rs 14,721. Small Non-Institutional Investors (sNII) will need to apply for a minimum of 14 lots (294 shares), which requires an investment of Rs 2,06,094. For large Non-Institutional Investors (bNII), the minimum application size is 68 lots (1,428 shares), amounting to Rs 10,01,028.LATEST GMP AND LISTING EXPECTATIONS The latest Grey Market Premium (GMP) for Concord Enviro Systems IPO stands at Rs 50, as of December 23, 2024. Based on the upper price band of Rs 701 per share, the estimated listing price is Rs 751. This suggests a potential gain of 7.13% for investors upon listing. Concord Enviro Systems Limited, established in July 1999, provides solutions for water and wastewater treatment. The company’s technologies include zero-liquid discharge (ZLD) systems, which enable the recycling and reuse of water. With a global presence, Concord Enviro serves industries that seek sustainable solutions to address water management challenges. The allotment of shares is expected to be finalised on December 24, 2024. The shares are scheduled to list on both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on December 27, 2024. Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors Limited and Equirus Capital Private Limited are the book-running lead managers for the IPO. Link Intime India Private Ltd has been appointed as the registrar for the issue, overseeing the allotment process and handling investor queries.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

This inclusion marks a significant milestone for the company.RELIANCE INDUSTRIES (RIL) Reliance Industries Ltd's subsidiary, Reliance Digital Health, has signed agreements to acquire a 45% equity stake in Health Alliance Group Inc (HAGI) for $10 million. UltraTech will make an open offer to public shareholders for an additional 26% stake at Rs 390 per share.INDIAN OIL CORPORATION (IOC) IOC's board has approved an investment of Rs 657.33 crore for a yarn project in Bhadrak, Odisha.TEAMLEASE SERVICES TeamLease Services has announced plans to acquire a 90% stake in TSR Darashaw HR Services and a 30% stake in Crystal HR and Security Solutions as part of its growth strategy.HINDUSTAN CONSTRUCTION COMPANY (HCC) HCC has sold its stake in Steiner AG through its subsidiaries to Uniresolv SA, a Geneva-based real estate and finance company.AGI GREENPAC The packaging firm's board has approved a fundraising plan of up to Rs 1,500 crore through various methods, including preferential issues and qualified institutional placements.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024: What is it and how to avail it?Settle tax disputes easily under the Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024 by paying the disputed tax and avoiding penalties.
Content: The Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme 2024, introduced in Budget 2024, provides taxpayers with an opportunity to settle pending disputes with the Income Tax Department. By paying the disputed tax amount along with a specified percentage, taxpayers can resolve disputes and avoid penalties and interest. If the payment and Form-1 submission are completed by December 31, 2024, the taxpayer can settle at a lower cost. Post this date, higher amounts apply.advertisementELIGIBILITY FOR THE SCHEMETaxpayers eligible for this scheme include: Taxpayers eligible for this scheme include: Those with pending appeals, writ petitions, or special leave petitions as of July 22, 2024. Individuals who filed objections before the Dispute Resolution Panel (DRP) before July 22, 2024, and await a decision. Cases where the DRP issued directions, but the assessment remains incomplete as of July 22, 2024. Taxpayers with revision applications under Section 264 pending on July 22, 2024.WHY CHOOSE THIS SCHEME? Experts highlight the benefits of resolving weaker cases and saving on litigation costs. Small disputes involving issues like capital gains, warranty claims, or unsecured loans can be settled efficiently. However, taxpayers are advised to evaluate their cases and seek professional guidance before opting in.APPLICATION PROCESS AND FORMS To apply, taxpayers need to submit: Form-1: Declaration and undertaking. Form-2: Acknowledgement certificate by the designated authority. Form-3: Payment intimation by the declarant. Form-4: Order for final settlement by the authority. Form 1 and 3 are submitted electronically on the Income Tax Department’s portal. This scheme is a valuable chance for taxpayers to settle disputes and avoid prolonged litigation. However, it is essential to assess the case’s merits with tax consultants before applying.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: F&O gamble: 5 reasons why options trading is a losing game for retail tradersOne of the biggest challenges retail traders face in India is the prohibitively high transaction costs. Unlike in the US, where brokerage fees are negligible and there are no transaction taxes, Indian traders face multiple layers of charges.
Content: India’s derivatives market has been witnessing unprecedented growth, with retail participation soaring from 5.1 million in FY22 to 9.6 million in FY24. The National Stock Exchange (NSE) recorded over 8.5 billion F&O contracts worth $1.1 trillion in April 2024 alone. However, beneath this surge lies a grim reality for retail investors. Dr. Jayatu Sen Chaudhury, Professor of Financial Analytics at Great Lakes Institute of Management, cited a recent study conducted by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) to highlight the fact that “for most retail traders, options trading is a losing game”. It may be noted that the Sebi study revealed the stark odds faced by retail traders, with 93% incurring net losses between FY22 and FY24, collectively losing over Rs 1.8 lakh crore ($21.6 billion) in three years. “Despite their enthusiasm and growing numbers, structural and systemic challenges in India’s options market have made consistent profitability elusive for retail participants,” Chaudhury said. In this article, Dr. Jayatu Sen Chaudhury highlights 5 major hurdles faced by retail investors.CRUSHING WEIGHT OF TRANSACTION COSTS One of the biggest challenges retail traders face in India is the prohibitively high transaction costs. Unlike in the US, where brokerage fees are negligible and there are no transaction taxes, Indian traders face multiple layers of charges: Securities Transaction Tax (STT): Levied at 0.125% of the premium on option sales, STT disproportionately affects small-scale, high-frequency trades. Brokerage Fees: Flat rates of Rs 20 per trade may seem minor but can represent a significant cost for low-value trades. Exchange Turnover Fees and GST: NSE/BSE turnover fees and an 18% GST on brokerage fees further inflate costs. For example, a Rs 100 premium option trade in India can incur Rs 37.67 (~4%) in transaction costs, compared to less than $1 (<1%) in the U.S. for a similar trade. Over three years, retail traders in India collectively spent Rs 50,000 crore ($6 billion) on transaction costs, creating an insurmountable break-even point for many.VOLATILITY AND LIMITED GAINS The Indian market’s inherent volatility adds another layer of complexity. While the Nifty Index’s average monthly return (2022–2024) was 1.2%, its standard deviation—a measure of risk—was two to three times that. This heightened variability makes both buying and selling index options risky propositions. Furthermore, options premiums plummet sharply just a few percentage points away from the current market price, leaving retail traders with minimal room for gains. In such a volatile environment, consistent profitability requires precise timing and advanced strategies, skills that most retail traders lack.KNOWLEDGE GAP A lack of understanding of options Greeks (Delta, Gamma, Theta, Vega) and advanced trading strategies like spreads or straddles hampers retail traders' ability to manage risk effectively. Instead of treating options trading as a strategic investment, many—particularly the younger demographic—approach it as speculation. The Sebi study found that 43% of retail traders were under 30 years old in FY24, up from 31% in FY23. Many of these young traders are swayed by "finfluencers," who often oversimplify options trading to sell courses, leaving inexperienced traders with unrealistic expectations.THE INSTITUTIONAL EDGE While retail traders struggle, institutional players thrive. Leveraging algorithmic trading systems, they execute high-frequency trades with precision, exploiting inefficiencies that retail traders cannot. In FY24 alone: Proprietary traders recorded gross trading profits of Rs 33,000 crore ($3.96 billion). Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) earned Rs 28,000 crore ($3.36 billion). A staggering 96–97% of these profits were attributed to algorithmic trading, highlighting the technological gap between retail and institutional players. Retail traders, lacking access to similar tools and data, are at a significant disadvantage.DEMOGRAPHIC DISADVANTAGE The Sebi report also highlighted that 75% of retail traders in the F&O segment had annual incomes below Rs 5 lakh ($6,000). For this demographic, trading beyond their financial capacity amplifies risks. Younger, inexperienced traders are particularly vulnerable, often enduring repeated losses in the hope of eventual success. Alarmingly, over 75% of losing traders persisted in trading despite consecutive losses, underscoring a dangerous cycle of overconfidence and lack of financial literacy.WHY RETAIL TRADERS RARELY WIN For retail traders, the odds of success are stacked against them due to: High Costs: Annual transaction costs per trader average Rs 26,000 ($310), significantly eroding potential profits. Time Decay (Theta): Options lose value as expiration nears, with over 70% expiring worthless. Wide Bid-Ask Spreads: These spreads further increase implicit trading costs. High Leverage Risks: While options provide leverage, they amplify losses, particularly in volatile markets. Lack of Education and Tools: Without sophisticated tools or a solid understanding of market dynamics, retail traders are at a perpetual disadvantage.WHAT NEEDS TO CHANGE? Recognising these challenges, Sebi has proposed measures to curb speculative trading and protect retail participants, including: Increasing minimum contract sizes: To deter small-capital speculative trades. Regulating weekly expiries: To reduce high-frequency trading pressure. While these steps are commendable, Dr. Jayatu Sen Chaudhury said robust investor education initiatives must complement these. “Retail traders need access to better tools, data, and training to navigate the complexities of options trading effectively," he said. "Unless structural reforms are implemented to reduce costs and level the playing field, options trading will continue to be a losing game for most retail investors in India. For now, the allure of quick riches remains a dangerous illusion for the average trader,” he added. Headline: GSTR-9 simplified: Filing, features, deadlines and other details GSTR-9 consolidates GST data for taxpayers exceeding Rs 2 crore turnover, ensuring accurate reconciliation and compliance.
Content: GSTR-9 is the annual return to be filed by taxpayers registered under Goods and Services Tax (GST), offering a comprehensive overview of sales, purchases, and the GST charged and paid during the financial year.KEY FEATURES OF GSTR-9 This return consolidates data from various monthly/quarterly returns, including GSTR-1, GSTR-2A, GSTR-2B, and GSTR-3B, for the entire financial year. It contains detailed information on both outward and inward supplies under different tax heads—CGST, SGST, IGST—along with cess and HSN codes. This thorough compilation allows for effective reconciliation, ensuring that taxpayers meet the necessary compliance standards.WHO NEEDS TO FILE GSTR-9? GSTR-9 is mandatory for GST taxpayers with an aggregate annual turnover exceeding Rs 2 crore for the financial year 2023-2024. However, the following categories are exempt from filing this return: Casual taxable persons Input service distributors TDS deductors TCS collectors Non-resident taxable persons The deadline for filing GSTR-9 for FY 2023-2024 is December 31, 2024.TYPES OF ANNUAL GST RETURNS There are various types of GST annual returns, depending on the taxpayer’s category: GSTR-9: For regular taxpayers filing GSTR-1 and GSTR-3B. GSTR-9A: For composition scheme taxpayers. GSTR-9B: For e-commerce operators who file GSTR-8. GSTR-9C: For taxpayers with an annual turnover of over Rs 5 crore, requiring audited accounts and a reconciliation statement.STEPS TO FILE GSTR-9 Ensure GSTR-1 and GSTR-3B are filed for FY 2023-24. Perform a detailed reconciliation of ITC and sales data. Address any discrepancies with vendors and customers. Use offline tools or cloud-based software like Clear for seamless filing. Settle any short tax payments or excess ITC claims using DRC-03. Submit GSTR-9 on the GST portal. Though filing GSTR-9 may seem complex, it plays a crucial role in ensuring compliance and transparency in GST filings. By carefully reconciling and filing on time, businesses can avoid penalties and stay on top of their tax obligations.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: Explained: Why India Cements share price surged 11% today Shares of India Cements rose after UltraTech Cement received a crucial approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI).
Content: Shares of India Cements Ltd surged 11% on Monday following news of UltraTech Cement receiving approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI) to acquire a majority stake in the company. UltraTech Cement plans to acquire 10,13,91,231 equity shares of India Cements, each valued at Rs 10. This represents a 32.72% stake in the company, held by its promoters, members of the promoter group, and another shareholder. In addition to the stake purchase, UltraTech Cement will make an open offer to acquire up to 8,05,73,273 equity shares from public shareholders. This open offer, which represents 26% of India Cements’ equity, is priced at Rs 390 per share. The offer price is a 15% premium over India Cements’ closing price of Rs 339 on Friday. The news sparked a rally in India Cements shares, which climbed 11% to reach Rs 376.30 during Monday’s trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). UltraTech Cement also saw a modest gain of 1.14%, with its shares trading at Rs 11,555 during the day. At the time the article was being written, India Cements shares were trading at Rs 368.50, up 8.65%.  The acquisition deal was first announced on July 28, 2024, with UltraTech Cement revealing plans to invest Rs 3,950 crore to acquire a significant stake in India Cements. UltraTech Cement had previously acquired a 23% stake in India Cements at Rs 268 per share. Market experts see this acquisition as a move that could lead to better price discipline in the cement industry. Consolidation in the sector is expected to improve profitability and enhance return ratios over the long term. For UltraTech Cement, the acquisition aligns with its growth strategy. The company aims to achieve a global production capacity of 200 million tonnes per annum (mtpa) by FY2027. UltraTech Cement's management reiterated its goal of double-digit volume growth for the second half of FY2025. This growth is expected to be driven by government spending on infrastructure projects, consistent demand from urban housing, and increased rural demand following good monsoons. Analysts have also highlighted UltraTech's continued focus on efficiency improvement, which supports its expansion plans. UltraTech Cement's acquisition of India Cements, along with its planned acquisition of Kesoram, is expected to be completed by the end of FY2025. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: From the world's richest to fifth: The ups and downs of Bernard Arnault Once the world's richest, Bernard Arnault lost $32 billion in 2024 but remains a luxury titan with LVMH's 75 iconic brands.
Content: Once the world’s richest person, Bernard Arnault, chairman and CEO of luxury goods giant LVMH, has seen his fortune take a dramatic hit in 2024. Despite his immense wealth, the French billionaire has slipped to fifth place on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, with a net worth of $176 billion after losing $32 billion year-to-date.advertisementTHE RISE AND FALL OF A LUXURY MOGULArnault first claimed the title of the world’s richest person in August 2021, fuelled by soaring luxury goods sales in Asia. Since then, his ranking has fluctuated, regaining the top spot briefly in 2022, 2023, and again in May 2024. Arnault first claimed the title of the world’s richest person in August 2021, fuelled by soaring luxury goods sales in Asia. Since then, his ranking has fluctuated, regaining the top spot briefly in 2022, 2023, and again in May 2024. However, a significant downturn followed in September 2024, when LVMH shares dropped 20%, translating to a $54 billion loss due to declining revenues. The company’s Chief Financial Officer, Jean-Jacques Guiony, attributed the revenue slump to geopolitical tensions affecting global markets. Arnault’s fall marks a stark contrast to the tech-dominated top billionaire list. He is the sole representative of the luxury goods industry in the top five, which is otherwise populated by tech tycoons like Elon Musk ($444 billion), Jeff Bezos ($244 billion), Mark Zuckerberg ($207 billion), and Larry Ellison ($190 billion). Some renowned names include Christian Dior, Bulgari, TAG Heuer, Hublot, Tiffany & Co., and Sephora. Headline: Salted, pre-packed or caramelised? Popcorn gets stuck in GST mazeThe GST Council's decision to impose different tax rates on salted, pre-packaged, and caramelised popcorn has faced criticism, with economists, industry experts, and former government officials arguing that the new tax structure adds complexity for consumers.
Content: Popcorn, a timeless snack enjoyed at movie nights, parties, and as a casual treat, has recently found itself at the heart of a complicated tax debate that’s stirring confusion and frustration across the country. The GST Council’s decision to impose different tax rates on salted, pre-packaged, and caramelised popcorn has faced criticism, with economists, industry experts, and former government officials arguing that the new tax structure adds complexity for consumers while failing to make a significant contribution to the government’s coffers. The tax structure is as follows: 5% GST on salted popcorn, 12% on pre-packaged and labeled popcorn, and a hefty 18% on caramelised popcorn. At first glance, the distinction between these varieties seems straightforward, but critics are questioning the logic behind it, especially when the potential revenue impact appears to be negligible. Former Chief Economic Advisor Krishnamurthy Subramanian is among those who have raised concerns about the new tax rates. Subramanian, known for his outspoken views, pointed out that the revenue generated from this differentiation would be minimal and hardly worth the hassle it could cause to ordinary citizens. In a social media post on X, Subramanian explained, “Estimated popcorn sales in 2025 (estimated from GlobalData) = Rs 1700 crore. Assuming the entire amount is taxed at 18%, GST collection from popcorn = Rs 300 crore. Total GST collection (estimated 2025) = Rs 22,00,000 crore. Max revenue contribution of popcorn decision = 300/2200000 = 0.013%!” He went on to question, “What is the rationale for a decision that can max contribute 0.013% to revenue but inconvenience citizens?” The debate over the popcorn tax has since snowballed, with some prominent voices chiming in, criticising the move as both “silly and complex.” Former Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai was quick to weigh in, calling the new rates “silly and complex” and warning that they could lead to what he described as “tax terrorism.” Pai raised alarm over how such policies could affect ordinary citizens and called for a simplification of the GST system. “This is silly and complex. Will lead to tax terrorism. Citizens are becoming victims of bad policy which will make them hostages to rent-seeking officials and create disputes. GST needs to be simplified, not this,” Pai said. Arvind Subramanian, another former CFO, added his voice to the chorus of critics, calling the decision a “national tragedy” and arguing that it went against the very spirit of the Goods and Services Tax, which was originally designed to simplify taxation across the country. However, the finance ministry has clarified that the GST Council’s recommendation wasn’t introducing a new tax, but rather offering clarification to resolve disputes that had arisen from the interpretation of existing tax rates. Despite the clarification, the damage had already been done. What started as a seemingly harmless tweak to the tax structure has become a focal point for critics, highlighting the complexities of India’s taxation system. Social media has exploded with memes and jokes about how popcorn—of all things—has become a symbol of the country’s complicated GST framework. But beyond the memes and the public outrage, the popcorn tax sheds light on a far bigger issue: the struggle to maintain a tax system that is both simple and effective. While policymakers are pushing for clarity, the real question remains: will popcorn be the tipping point that forces a serious overhaul of India’s convoluted tax structure?Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: PM-JAY for senior citizens: How to register for free health insuranceAyushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana ensures senior citizens over 70 get free health insurance of Rs 5 lakh annually, with a simple enrolment process to make healthcare more accessible.
Content: The Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) offers free health insurance of up to Rs 5 lakh every year to senior citizens. This initiative targets vulnerable sections of society, including senior citizens over 70, regardless of their income. The scheme, a flagship project by the Government of India, ensures that millions of senior citizens have access to quality healthcare without financial strain.advertisementENROLLING IN THE SCHEME: A SIMPLE PROCESSSenior citizens or their family members can begin the enrolment process by downloading the Ayushman Bharat app from the Google Play Store or the official website. Once downloaded, users can select their preferred language to navigate through the process smoothly. Senior citizens or their family members can begin the enrolment process by downloading the Ayushman Bharat app from the Google Play Store or the official website. Once downloaded, users can select their preferred language to navigate through the process smoothly. To start enrolment, users must click on the ‘Login as beneficiary’ option, entering the captcha and their mobile number. After receiving an OTP, the login is complete, and they can move on to the senior citizen’s enrolment section at the bottom of the home screen.AADHAAR VERIFICATION AND FINAL SUBMISSION A key step in the process is Aadhaar validation. After entering the Aadhaar number, users will receive an OTP on the registered mobile number for validation. They will then need to select their state of residence, after which a search option will confirm whether the senior citizen is already enroled. If not, fresh enrolment is required, followed by another OTP verification. The process also includes taking a live photo for identity verification. After providing all required details—such as address, city, state, ward information, and contact number—the application can be submitted. Upon approval, the beneficiary receives the Ayushman card, ready to avail of the benefits.A HEALTHIER FUTURE FOR SENIOR CITIZENS With over 36 crore beneficiaries already verified under the scheme, PM-JAY is transforming healthcare for India’s elderly population. By simplifying the enrolment process, this initiative empowers senior citizens with access to essential health services, making healthcare more accessible and affordable for all.Published By: Published On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: NSE, BSE to keep markets open on February 1 for Union Budget 2025The practice of keeping markets open during Budget Day is not new. In the past, trading was also allowed on non-working days to facilitate real-time market reactions to Budget announcements.
Content: The National Stock Exchange (NSE) and Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) have announced that the markets will remain open for live trading on February 1, 2025, coinciding with the presentation of the Union Budget. This decision was shared by the exchanges through a circular issued on December 23. The circular said, "On account of the presentation of the Union Budget, Exchange shall be conducting live trading session on February 1, 2025." This practice of keeping markets open during Budget Day is not new. In the past, trading was also allowed on non-working days, such as Saturday, February 1, 2020, and Saturday, February 28, 2015, to facilitate real-time market reactions to Budget announcements. The NSE has further clarified that the “T0” session, typically used for certain types of trading and settlements, will not be scheduled on February 1 due to the day being a settlement holiday. This means certain trades that require same-day settlement will not occur on that day. Budget Day is one of the most anticipated events in the financial calendar, as announcements made during the Union Budget often influence market trends and investor sentiment. Decisions related to taxation, government spending, and economic reforms have a direct impact on sectors across the economy, leading to heightened trading activity and volatility in the markets. The decision to keep trading open on February 1 allows investors and market participants to respond to the announcements in real-time. It also provides a platform for price discovery and facilitates smooth market operations during this significant economic event.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024Must Watch

Headline: IPOs in 2024: Big ticket listings that failed to impressRecord-breaking IPOs in India coexist with the struggles of billion-dollar listings, reflecting both market resilience and investor caution.
Content: India’s IPO (Initial Public Offering) market has witnessed remarkable growth over the past decade, with companies raising record-breaking funds. Yet, not every debut has sustained its billion-dollar momentum. At least eight IPOs with billion-dollar valuations struggled post-launch, leaving investors counting their losses.BILLION-DOLLAR IPOS THAT LOST THEIR SHINE According to a report by Motilal Oswal, several prominent companies, including Indigo Paints, Ujjivan Small Finance Bank (SFB), Powergrid Infrastructure Investment Trust, and Chemplast Sanmar, have slipped below their debut valuations. Indigo Paints debuted in January 2021 with a $2.03 billion market cap but now stands at $0.82 billion—less than half its initial valuation. Ujjivan SFB went public in December 2019 with a $1.36 billion valuation, but has since dropped to $0.81 billion. Operational challenges, market corrections, and sector-specific headwinds have significantly eroded these valuations. Similarly, Powergrid Infrastructure Investment Trust and Chemplast Sanmar, which debuted with $1.28 billion and $1.14 billion market caps, respectively, now hover below the billion-dollar mark. Other names in this list include Juniper Hotels, TVS Supply Chain Solutions, and TN Mercantile Bank.IPO MARKET RESILIENCE AMID SETBACKS Despite these setbacks, the Indian IPO market has continued to thrive. This year alone, companies raised a record Rs 1.8 lakh crore through 317 IPOs, surpassing the Rs 1.3 lakh crore raised in CY21. The contribution of IPOs to market capitalisation increased to 2.9% in CY24 from 1.4% in CY23, although it still lags behind the highs of CY17 (3.7%) and CY21 (3.4%). E-commerce, telecom, and retail sectors have driven recent IPO success, reflecting India’s growing digital economy and consumer base. Meanwhile, cyclical sectors like capital goods and real estate have seen fluctuating participation due to market dynamics.THE DUALITY OF SUCCESS India’s IPO market showcases both immense potential and inherent risks. While the record fundraising highlights investor confidence, the struggles of once-billion-dollar IPOs remind us that market dynamics can quickly change fortunes. Headline: Are stock markets closed on December 25? Check the full 2025 holiday scheduleOn regular weekdays, the stock market operates from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM. A pre-opening session takes place from 9:00 AM to 9:15 AM to set the tone for the trading day.
Content: The stock markets, including the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE), will remain closed on Wednesday, December 25, 2024, in observance of Christmas. This holiday marks the last stock market holiday of the year. Along with Indian markets, major global stock exchanges in countries like the United States, the United Kingdom, and across Europe will also remain closed. Both the BSE and NSE will suspend trading across all segments, including equities, derivatives, and securities lending and borrowing (SLB) on December 25. Furthermore, the commodity markets, including the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) and the National Commodity & Derivatives Exchange (NCDEX), will also remain shut for both morning and evening sessions. Trading will resume as usual on Thursday, December 26, 2024. 2025 stock market holiday calendar The stock market holiday schedule for 2025 includes several national and religious holidays. The markets will close on February 26 for Mahashivratri, March 14 for Holi, and March 31 for Id-Ul-Fitr (Ramadan Eid). In April, there are closures on April 10 for Shri Mahavir Jayanti, April 14 for Dr Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti, and April 18 for Good Friday. Maharashtra Day on May 1 and Independence Day on August 15 are also holidays. Later in August, the market will be shut on August 27 for Ganesh Chaturthi. October has three holidays, including Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti/Dussehra on October 2, Diwali Laxmi Pujan on October 21, and Diwali Balipratipada on October 22. November 5 is reserved for Prakash Gurpurb Sri Guru Nanak Dev. Christmas on December 25 will again mark the final holiday for 2025. In addition, the markets will hold Muhurat Trading on Tuesday, October 21, 2025, during Diwali. The exact timings for this special trading session will be announced later. On regular weekdays, the Indian stock market operates from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM. A pre-opening session takes place from 9:00 AM to 9:15 AM to set the tone for the trading day. The market is closed on Saturdays and Sundays.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Which Indian insurance companies reject claims the least? Report reveals truthPeople don't just put in money but trust when they buy insurance policies to cover for medical emergencies or motor accidents. A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.
Content: People buy general insurance to cover for emergencies so that they do not have to make out-of-pocket hefty payments. They do not just put their money in, but trust while paying premiums. However, not all claims get approved. A recent report reveals that the claim-to-settlement ratio, which shows how many claims were honoured by insurers, in 2022-23 at 86%, which is down from the 87% in FY22. The detailed report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India (IBAI) from data presented by insurance companies reveals that claims repudiation ratio rose to 6% for general insurance, which includes coverage for motor, health, fire and marine cargo. This is the claim rejected by an insurance company as a proportion of the total claims made by its policy buyers. Public sector insurer New India Assurance has the lowest claims repudiation ratio of 0.2%. Other big private insurers with lower rates of claims rejection are HDFC Ergo, Future Generali, Aditya Birla Health and Shriram. Insurance watchdog IRDAI makes it mandatory for insurance companies to put out settlements and rejection data on their websites. The IBAI has collated the data from insurers and put it in a report, which could help people make informed choices about a company's track record while buying insurance policies. In the Policyholder's Handbook, the IBAI has classified the general insurers into four categories -- Public Sector General Insurers, Large Private Sector General Insurers, Other Private Sector Insurers, and Standalone Health Insurers. In the health insurance category too, New India Assurance came on top among the public insurers with a claim-settlement ratio of 95%. Aditya Birla Health, with a claim settlement ratio of 95%, was the best among standalone health insurers. Iffco Tokio and Bajaj Allianz were among the top large private sector general insurers with the best claims-to-settlement ratio of 90% or more, according to the IBAI handbook. What has to be remembered in the case of health insurance is that it is combined data for group (corporate) and individual policies. Claim-rejection rates are historically lower in the case of corporate policies. "Irdai does not give data for individual and group claims separately. Why not? Who is it protecting," asked author-influencer Monika Halan. The real picture will emerge when separate claim-settlement data is available for individual health insurance policies. According to experts, incomplete or false disclosure, consciously or unconsciously, at the time of purchase of policies also contribute to rejection of claims.   In settling motor vehicle own-damage claims too, New India Assurance was the best public insurer with a claim-settlement ratio of 92%. Among large private sector insurers when it came to own-damage claim settlement, Royal Sundaram, Go Digit and SBI General came on top. Future Generali was the top among small insurers. The insurance coverage, be it life or general, is low in India but the tax on insurance premiums, at 18%, is high. In India, insurance penetration is at 30%, and low in comparison to developed countries, like the US, where it is over 90%. Though there is no social security net and government medical infrastructure is rickety, the high 18% GST on insurance premiums defies logic. Many users settle for a smaller cover due to high premiums, experts have told India Today Digital. Several reform measures are needed for the growth of the insurance industry and relief for people so that they can get better cover for themselves. Not just in terms of reduction of tax, there is a need for segregated data on claim-settlement ratios for individual and group policies for people to make an informed choice.Published By: Sushim MukulPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Apple nears $4 trillion valuation amid AI push and iPhone upgrade hopesApple's strategic push into AI and its resilience in navigating market challenges have positioned the tech giant as a leader in the sector.
Content: Technology giant and iPhone maker Apple is edging closer to an extraordinary milestone, with its market valuation nearing $4 trillion. Investor confidence in the company’s artificial intelligence (AI) advancements and expectations of a new iPhone upgrade cycle have fuelled a 16% surge in its stock since November, adding $500 billion to its market capitalisation. Currently valued at $3.86 trillion, Apple’s market cap surpasses the combined worth of the leading stock indices of Germany and Switzerland. The strong rally reflects the growing optimism about Apple’s evolving AI strategy and its potential to reinvigorate product demand.advertisementAPPLE'S AI PUSHIn December, Apple began incorporating OpenAI’s ChatGPT into its devices, part of its broader initiative to integrate generative AI into its app ecosystem—a strategy announced earlier in June. Analysts view this move as pivotal, particularly in addressing lackluster demand for the iPhone 16 series during the holiday season. In December, Apple began incorporating OpenAI’s ChatGPT into its devices, part of its broader initiative to integrate generative AI into its app ecosystem—a strategy announced earlier in June. Analysts view this move as pivotal, particularly in addressing lackluster demand for the iPhone 16 series during the holiday season. Speaking to news agency Reuters, Tom Forte, an analyst at Maxim Group, attributed the market’s enthusiasm to Apple’s AI progress and the possibility of a “supercycle” of iPhone upgrades. Similarly, Morgan Stanley’s Erik Woodring forecasted a recovery in iPhone sales by 2025, driven by the expanded rollout of Apple’s AI features. Woodring reiterated Apple as Morgan Stanley’s top investment pick for the year ahead. Despite these advancements, Apple’s immediate revenue growth for the fiscal first quarter is projected to remain modest. Meanwhile, its price-to-earnings ratio has reached 33.5, the highest in nearly three years, eclipsing major tech competitors like Microsoft and Nvidia. This elevated valuation has sparked concerns over inflated stock prices, prompting Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway to reduce its Apple holdings. Even with potential headwinds, such as the possibility of new tariffs on Chinese imports under the incoming U.S. administration, analysts remain optimistic. Past exemptions secured by Apple during prior tariff rounds provide hope for minimal disruptions. Apple’s strategic push into AI and its resilience in navigating market challenges have positioned the tech giant as a leader in the sector. As the company inches closer to the historic $4 trillion valuation, it continues to captivate investor confidence and maintain its dominance in the global marketPublished By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

The surge followed reports that Tata Capital is gearing up for an initial public offering (IPO) worth Rs 15,000 crore. The IPO will aim to comply with regulatory norms and is expected to be one of the largest public offerings in the Indian market. Law firm Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas and investment bank Kotak Mahindra Capital have reportedly been appointed as advisors for the proposed deal. In October, the RBI approved the merger of Tata Capital with Tata Motors Finance Limited (TMFL), creating India’s 12th-largest NBFC. This no-objection approval by the central bank sets the stage for Tata Capital’s public listing. Regulatory filings suggest that Tata Capital could list by September 2024, well ahead of the 2025 deadline. Tata Investment Corporation is one of the largest shareholders of Tata Sons, the holding company for Tata Capital. TICL’s close association with Tata Sons explains the strong investor interest in its shares, given the anticipated value unlock from the Tata Capital IPO. The Tata Group’s most recent IPO, Tata Technologies, delivered a stellar performance in the secondary market. Listed on November 30, 2023, Tata Technologies’ shares debuted with a 140% premium to their issue price of Rs 500. The IPO, entirely an offer for sale (OFS), was subscribed 69.43 times, reflecting robust investor appetite for Tata Group offerings. Tata Technologies was the first IPO from the group in nearly two decades, with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) being the previous IPO in 2004. The Tata Capital IPO marks another milestone for the conglomerate, highlighting its commitment to enhancing transparency and unlocking value for investors. As preparations for the Tata Capital IPO advance, market participants remain optimistic about the potential impact on Tata Group entities. The rally in TICL shares underscores growing anticipation for what could be one of India’s most significant IPOs in recent years.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Who is Aakash Chaudhry? Zerodha, Zomato founders bet on Sparkl EdventureInvestors include Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal and Zerodha founder Nithin Kamath, who have backed the platform that aims to transform personalised learning for students.
Content: Aakash Chaudhry, a well-known name in India’s education sector, has raised $4 million for his new venture, Sparkl Edventure. Investors include Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal and Zerodha founder Nithin Kamath, who have backed the platform that aims to transform personalised learning for students. Sparkl, launched just two months ago, is Chaudhry’s major project since the $1 billion sale of his previous firm, Aakash Educational Services Limited (AESL), to Byju’s in 2021. Chaudhry, who serves as founder and managing director of Sparkl, said the platform’s mission is to deliver one-on-one, personalised tutoring tailored to the unique needs of each student. “Our vision at Sparkl is to empower students with personalised, one-on-one learning that adapts to their individual needs. With the support of visionary leaders like Nithin Kamath and Deepinder Goyal, we are poised to revolutionise the tutoring landscape,” he said in a statement. Sparkl was co-founded by Chaudhry alongside Pavan Chauhan, the co-founder of meritnation.com, and Ritesh Hemrajani. The team aims to leverage artificial intelligence (AI) and expert teaching to meet the demands of students pursuing international curricula like IB, IGCSE, and A-levels. Zerodha founder and Rainmatter head Nithin Kamath expressed his belief in the potential of personalised education to improve learning outcomes. “I’ve been wondering for a long time if students will have different outcomes if they have access to education that is more personalised and customised. When I heard what Aakash and his team were planning, I was convinced that something like this should be available for students. We are happy to join them in this journey,” Kamath said. Deepinder Goyal of Zomato also participated in this funding round, adding to the growing interest in tech-driven education platforms. Sparkl’s co-founder and CEO, Pavan Chauhan, said the platform is focused on delivering a personalised experience for students. “By focusing on IB, IGCSE, and A-level students, we aim to meet the growing demand for specialised and effective learning solutions. The support from Nithin and Deepinder strengthens our resolve to expand our impact globally,” he said. Chaudhry is no stranger to success in the education industry. As the managing director of AESL, he played a key role in growing the brick-and-mortar test preparation giant, which was known for its coaching services in competitive exams like NEET and JEE. Under his leadership, AESL became a household name, ultimately catching the attention of Byju’s, which acquired the firm in 2021 for nearly $1 billion in a cash-and-stock deal.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Sanathan Textiles IPO allotment: Check step-by-step guide to check statusSanathan Textiles IPO: Investors can verify their allotment status through two platforms: the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the KFin Technologies portal. Here's a step-by-step guide:
Content: Sanathan Textiles is set to finalise the allotment of its IPO shares on Tuesday, December 24. Investors who participated in the offering can expect to receive notifications regarding fund debits or IPO mandate revocations by Thursday, December 26. The IPO, which ran from December 19 to December 23, garnered an overwhelming response from investors. The issue, priced between Rs 305 and Rs 321 per share with a lot size of 46 shares, raised Rs 550 crore. This included a fresh issue worth Rs 400 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of â‚¹150 crore. Sanathan Textiles’ IPO was subscribed 35.12 times overall, reflecting robust demand. The qualified institutional buyer (QIB) portion was subscribed 75.62 times, while non-institutional investors (NIIs) booked 42.21 times their allocation. The retail segment saw 8.93 times subscription. The grey market premium (GMP) for Sanathan Textiles currently stands at â‚¹85-90, indicating potential listing gains of around 26-28%. The company’s shares are scheduled to list on both the BSE and NSE on Friday, December 27.HOW TO CHECK SANATHAN TEXTILES IPO ALLOTMENT STATUS Investors can verify their allotment status through two platforms: the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the KFin Technologies portal. Here’s a step-by-step guide:ON THE BSE WEBSITE Visit the BSE allotment page: BSE IPO Allotment. Select "Equity" under the issue type. Choose "Sanathan Textiles Limited" from the issue name dropdown. Enter your application number and PAN ID. Complete the CAPTCHA and click “Search.”ON THE KFIN TECHNOLOGIES PORTAL Go to the KFinTech allotment page: KFin IPO Allotment. Select "Sanathan Textiles Limited" from the IPO dropdown (visible if allotment is finalized). Choose one of the three identification methods: Application number, Demat account number, or PAN ID. Under application type, select either ASBA or non-ASBA. Provide the required details and complete the CAPTCHA. Click "Submit" to view your allotment status.KEY IPO DETAILS Sanathan Textiles, incorporated in 2005, specialises in polyester yarn manufacturing and is a global supplier of cotton yarn. Its business spans three verticals: polyester yarn, cotton yarn, and technical and industrial yarn products. DAM Capital Advisors and ICICI Securities managed the IPO as lead book runners, with KFin Technologies serving as the registrar. The registrar will handle all investor-related queries and ensure a smooth allotment process.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Tata Capital IPO buzz? All you need to knowIf the IPO goes through, it will be the Tata Group's second public offering in two decades. The last one was Tata Technologies' IPO in November last year.
Content: The Tata Group is preparing for a $2 billion initial public offering (IPO) of its financial services arm, Tata Capital, reported The Economic Times. Discussions with investment bankers have already begun, with Kotak Investment Banking taking the lead. The conglomerate is expected to finalise additional bankers for the process by January next year. The IPO comes as part of a regulatory requirement from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). Under RBI guidelines, Tata Sons and Tata Capital, classified as upper-layer non-banking financial companies (NBFCs), are required to list their shares by September 2025. Tata Sons currently holds a 93% stake in Tata Capital.advertisementSECOND IPO FOR TATA IN TWO DECADESIf the IPO goes through, it will be the Tata Group’s second public offering in two decades. The last one was Tata Technologies’ IPO in November last year, which saw investor interest. Before that, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) launched its IPO in 2004, raising Rs 5,500 crore. If the IPO goes through, it will be the Tata Group’s second public offering in two decades. The last one was Tata Technologies’ IPO in November last year, which saw investor interest. Before that, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) launched its IPO in 2004, raising Rs 5,500 crore. Tata Capital’s unlisted shares have already seen strong demand in the unlisted market. Shares that were priced at Rs 450 in December 2023 surged to Rs 1,100 by April this year. The current trading price is around Rs 900, which values the company at approximately Rs 3.5 lakh crore, based on its 3.74 billion outstanding shares at the end of FY24. Tata Capital is the holding company for the Tata Group’s various lending and investment businesses. These include Tata Capital Financial Services, Tata Capital Housing Finance, Tata Cleantech Capital, Tata Securities, Tata Capital Singapore, and a private equity arm. The company plays a key role in the Tata Group’s operations, providing financial support to suppliers, vendors, and dealers associated with the conglomerate. For the financial year ending March 31, 2024, Tata Capital reported a revenue of Rs 18,178 crore, reflecting a 34% increase from FY23. The company also posted a net profit of Rs 3,315 crore, a 12% rise compared to the previous year. Its net worth stood at Rs 23,417 crore as of March 31, 2024.RBI'S CLASSIFICATION  In September 2022, the RBI classified Tata Capital Financial Services as an upper-layer systemically important NBFC. This classification requires the company to comply with stricter regulatory norms, including mandatory listing within three years. Tata Capital raised Rs 593.80 crore in FY23 through a rights issue, offering shares at Rs 125.10 each. The funds have been utilised to strengthen the company’s financial position and expand its lending and advisory businesses.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: 18% GST on used cars: Will it leave you paying more?The decision has sparked debates as it comes at a time when India's used car market is poised for growth. Many believe the move aims to tap into the rapidly expanding sector to boost government revenue.
Content: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council's decision to increase the GST rate on old and used vehicles to 18% has stirred discussions across the country. The revised rate, announced at the 55th GST Council meeting, applies to all old and used vehicles, including electric vehicles (EVs), sold by registered businesses. However, individuals who are not registered under GST remain unaffected by this change. The decision has sparked debates as it comes at a time when India’s used car market is poised for growth. Many believe the move aims to tap into the rapidly expanding sector to boost government revenue.FINANCE MINISTER'S CLARIFICATION SPARKS CONFUSION While the increase in GST aims to streamline tax rates across different types of vehicles, earlier clarification by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on the issue left buyers and sellers unsure about how the new rates would affect them. The Finance Minister said that GST is calculated on the difference between the actual price and the resale price. "It is on that margin, the value between purchased price and resale price. Bought it for Rs 12 lakh, selling it for Rs 9 lakh in the name of a second-hand used vehicle; on the margin only this 18% has been put," the Finance Minister said.  However, the explanation raised questions about how the margin would be determined and whether the increase in GST would ultimately lead to losses for sellers.WHY WAS 18% GST LEVIED ON SALE OF USED CARS Explaining the decision, Amit Malviya, In-charge of the BJP’s National Information & Technology Department, clarified that the 18% GST is calculated only on the margin earned by dealers—the difference between the sale price and purchase price of the vehicle—and not on the total value of the vehicle. “If the margin is negative, no GST is payable. This approach ensures that the tax reflects the value addition by the dealer, which is considered a service under the GST framework,” Malviya said on X. He further added that taxing the dealer’s margin is not new. “This method was also in place during the UPA era as ‘Service Tax’ and continued until 2017.” Previously, old and used petrol, LPG, or CNG vehicles with an engine capacity of 1200 cc or more, as well as diesel vehicles with engines of 1500 cc or more, were already subject to 18% GST since 2018. Similarly, old and used EVs were taxed at 12%. The latest move standardises the GST rate for all old and used vehicles, including EVs, at 18%.BOOMING USED CAR MARKET The timing of this decision aligns with the rapid growth of India’s used car market. According to the Indian Blue Book 2023 report by Das Welt Auto and Car&Bike, the used car market in India was valued at USD 31.33 billion in 2022-23 and is projected to grow to USD 70.48 billion by 2027-28. The report highlights that the market’s average growth rate, which was 6% between FY2017 and FY2022, is expected to jump to 16% between FY2023 and FY2028. Comparatively, the new car market is expected to grow at a much slower pace of 1% to 6% during the same period. Factors such as a growing middle class, higher disposable incomes, and an increasing demand for personal mobility have contributed to the sector’s rapid expansion. The GST increase is expected to impact businesses involved in the sale of old and used vehicles, particularly dealers who claim depreciation on purchased vehicles. While the tax will not affect individuals buying or selling vehicles privately, businesses will need to factor the higher rate into their pricing strategies.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024
